text: Morning all, I am not sure what the right channel to ask is as I am new to this so asking in here :slightly_smiling_face: I need a Lead Forensics code added to the body element of our website and was referred to Slack from HubSpot support. Could anyone help me with this please? Thanks!

You can find a general header/footer area in the settings -> tools -> Pages. In the template tab you will find an area for adding stuff to either the head or the footer.  This affects all pages you are currently hosting on HubSpot.
If that is too much, you can find a similar section for each page in the settings tab of each page.

If the code needs to run before the page is loaded, you would add a script in the head that generates your body element and append it to the body.

If the code can run after the page is loaded, the footer option would be preferred as it is not blocking the rendering.
Yep, there’s a feedback form at the bottom of every dev doc, submit it there and a member of our team will review it and act on it.

Hi guys! I am having a problem with a free account.

I am developing some modules (on my developer account) with a library but I am trying to use these modules on a client account and I don't know why they are not working correctly.

I would like to ask if you know of any restrictions on this type of account and if there is anything I can do.

Hey HubSpot team-- I applied my app into the marketplace Thursday last week. This morning I logged into my dev account and say there were 17 apps ahead of me. When I checked the browser a few hours later for some reason my application was in draft again and it made me resubmit. Now I am 59th in line. Can someone please help?
you get to the end of the line when you resubmit
it is stated in the docs
Did you read the whole message? It put it in draft-- I had to resubmitt
yes i read the whole message
Why would an application go into draft after being submitted for a week without being reviewed?

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
There shouldn’t be any restrictions regarding that - I would look in the clients portal design manager: you will most likely find some hints in your module uploaded to them.

Hey HubSpot team,

Regarding my dilemma, I work with <http://reviews.io|reviews.io> and we have syndication together I've been trying to figure out a huge step in our current integrations regarding our dynamic link feature as this is the method we are using to help our clients collect reviews through your platform please view the example below:

<https://www.reviews.io/store/landing_new_review?store=www.londonspeechworkshop.com&user=><customer name>&order_id=<order reference>&email=<customer email address>&products=<product sku>&l=<language>&type=<review type>&video_campaign_id=<video_campaign_id>

What I need help with is figuring out which placeholders you currently have to allow our clients to collect  customer name, email, order ID, review type, and product SKU this identifier might be called something different on your end.

I would really appreciate it if we can figure this out.
Thank you

Hi HubSpot team,
Currently I am implementing the HubSpot quote apis in my website. So just want to know is there any api to update the quote status from `Waiting for payment` to `paid` ?
